text:
(1) First Ave., west side, north from, and including East 35th to, and including East 36th Streets. Also shown is East 36th Street, (across St. Gabriel's Park), north side, west from First, to and including Second Aves. A general view of mid-town Manhattan appears and shows, from left to right, 10 East 40th Street, 40 East 41st Street, Lincoln, Chanin, Chrysler and the Daily News Buildings.

April 27, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from a different angle.

April 8, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

Also shown is East 36th Street, (across St. Gabriel's Park), north side, west from First, to and including Second Aves. April 8, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)

First Ave., west side, north from East 35th Street. Also shown (across St. Gabriel's Park) is East 36th Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of First Ave. April 8, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

The same, north from and including East 36th Street. Spired buildings shown are a portion of Tudor City. April 8, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)

The same as No. 2. October 12, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

P. L. Sperr.

P. L. Sperr.

St. Gabriel's Park, from N.W. corner of First Avenue and 35th Street, showing St. Gabriel's Parochial School on the north side of 36th Street, the spire of St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church, which is on the south side of 37th Street, and a ghostlike line of skyscrapers on the horizon. From left to right they are: 10 East 40th Street (1930), the New York Trust Building at 277 Madison Avenue (1931), the Lefcourt Colonial Building (1929) at 297 Madison Avenue (corner of 41st Street) 500 Fifth Avenue (1931) nearly hidden by the Lefcourt Colonial, the Lincoln Building (1929) at 60 East 42nd Street (between Madison and Park Avenues), the Chanin Building (early 1929) on Lexington Avenue (north side) from 41st to 42nd Streets, the Chrysler Building (1930) diagonally across Lexington Avenue and 42nd Street from the Chanin Building, and the Daily News Building on the south side of 42nd Street, east of Third Avenue.

September 11, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

320 East 35th Street, south side, between First and Second Avenues. This is a three-story frame house with a stucco front.
1932.

(1)
St. Gabriel's Park, looking N.W. across the Park from 35th Street west of First Avenue. The five-story building on 36th Street is St. Gabriel's School; to the right of it may be seen the spire of St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church, which is on the south side of 37th Street.
The Chrysler Building, Lexington Avenue and 42nd St., is almost directly in line with the church. The Chanin Building (122 East 42nd Street) and the Lincoln Building (60 East 42nd Street) rise on the horizon behind the school.
June 14, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A view of the western portion of the Park under improvement. Across same appears St. Gabriels Hall and the St. Gabriels Branch of the New York Public Library; both on 36th Street. Second Ave. (shown with elevated thereon) is the western boundary. Prominent structures, not shown in No. 1 are, 10 East 40th Street, and the Lefcourt Colonial.
April 8, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

(1)
St. Gabriel's Park, looking N.W. across the Park from 35th Street west of First Avenue. The five-story building on 36th Street is St. Gabriel's School; to the right of it may be seen the spire of St. Gabriel's Roman Catholic Church, which is on the south side of 37th Street.
The Chrysler Building, Lexington Avenue and 42nd St., is almost directly in line with the church. The Chanin Building (122 East 42nd Street) and the Lincoln Building (60 East 42nd Street) rise on the horizon behind the school.
June 14, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A view of the western portion of the Park under improvement. Across same appears St. Gabriels Hall and the St. Gabriels Branch of the New York Public Library; both on 36th Street. Second Ave. (shown with elevated thereon) is the western boundary. Prominent structures, not shown in No. 1 are, 10 East 40th Street, and the Lefcourt Colonial.
April 8, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

First Avenue, at the S. E. corner of E. 35th Street, showing an automobile junk yard. The avenue is on the left and 35th Street runs across the top. A limited part of the N. Y. Steam Co. plant appears on the north side of same.

1939

Alexander Alland

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.

First Avenue, east side, north from E. 35th Street.

January 7, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

First Avenue, west side, north from E. 35th Street, showing the easterly end of St. Gabriel's Park extending to 36th Street. The buildings appearing on the latter thoroughfare will be razed in June for the Queens Midtown Tunnel. Across the roofs of same, from left to right, appear the Chrysler, News, and Tudor City buildings.

January 7, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

East 35th Street, west from First Avenue, showing the southeasterly corner of St. Gabriel's Park, buildings on the left facing same, the Second Avenue "El" across the center, the St. Gabriel's branch of the New York Public Library and the Parochial School of that name. In the distant background appears the Empire State Building (left) and skyscrapers of the 42nd Street-Grand Central Zone (right).

January 7, 1939

Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority
